intro: Gymnopogon fastigiatus subsp. jubiflorus, commonly known as the tall spikegrass, is a perennial grass species native to parts of southern Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense, spike-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in grassland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features include narrow, linear leaves and small, pale green flowers arranged in a compact panicle. This subspecies is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
